lieu: Graduate School of Surveying and Topography Engineers (ESGT-CNAM), Le Mans, Sarthe (72), FRANCE

images_data.image_caption: Graduate School of Surveying and Topography Engineers

nom: Advanced Technician's Certificate (BTS) in Surveying and Digital Modeling (MGTMN)
lieu: Lycée Le Caousou, Toulouse, Haute-Garonne (31), FRANCE
description_mission: Training in surveying, geomatics, and digital modeling. Acquisition of technical and theoretical skills for surveys, data processing, and plan production.

nom: Mission D10 - French School of Athens
membres: Mr. Jean-Marc LUCE (Mission Director, Professor-Researcher); Mr. Lionel FADIN (Internship Supervisor, Engineer at EfA); Ms. Audrey FOURTET, Sarah ANNEL, Emilie SOUERES, Manuel CASTET (students).
description_mission: Volunteer intern on a mission (D10) under the aegis of the French School at Athens, directed by Mr. Jean-Marc LUCE, at the archaeological site of Delphi (Sanctuary of Apollo), Greece.
Survey of points of interest using a GNSS receiver (extents, heights of enclosure walls, Hi-Target V200).

nom: Mission D28 - French School of Athens
membres: Sandrine HUBER (Mission Director, Professor-Researcher), Lionel FADIN (Internship Supervisor, Engineer at EfA); as well as the Universities of Lille, Strasbourg, and Padua; the CNRS
description_mission: Volunteer intern on a mission (D28) under the aegis of the French School at Athens and directed by Ms. Sandrine HUBER, at the archaeological site of Delphi (Marmaria Terraces), Greece.

Survey of points of interest (excavation limits, unearthed archaeological material, stratigraphic units, Leica TS06+) within the excavation trenches, recorded in a GIS, facilitating studies conducted by the different parties.
3D modeling of the trenches through photogrammetry to document sedimentary layers and discovered archaeological material.
Data archiving (coordinates, point nature, stratigraphic identification, material identification, orthoimages), allowing for filtering and obtaining specific data.
Link to the official EfA report: https://urlr.me/rPsKbC

TS06+ Station, myself, Lionel Fadin (from left to right)

titre: Monitoring of the Arcouzan Glacier (altitude approx. 2400m)
lieu: Arcouzan Glacier, Mont Valier, Seix, Ariège (09), FRANCE
membres: Mr. Guillaume BERNOLE and Mr. Bruno COLAS (High-Mountain Guides); Mr. Jean-Sébastien RIVERE, Mr. Vincent BERTHAUD and Mr. Aurélien VEAUTE (Chartered Surveyors); Mr. Philippe SABLAYROLLES (BTS MGTMN pedagogical coordinators); Ms. Aurore BRILLAC, Mr. Rémi LOURDEAUX and Manuel CASTET (students); Mr. Farhes MAHI (Teria Company); Mr. Jasper VOS (Topcon Company)
competences: Introduction to aerial survey techniques using DJI Mavic Pro drone
description_mission: Organization and preparation of expedition equipment (tripods, GNSS antennas, 3D scanner) for carrying and ascent (1300m D+) to the Refuge des Estagnous (2246m).
Deployment of a GNSS receiver (base, Topcon HiPer VR) at the Col du Valiérat and roped descent to the glacier site, under the supervision of high-mountain guides.

Survey of points, using a Topcon GLS-2000 3D scanner, a GNSS receiver (mobile, linking the scan and the image capture, Topcon HiPer VR), and a drone (DJI Mavic Pro), on the glacier's surface to measure its evolution (movement, melting, crevasses).
Collaboration within a multidisciplinary team in an ostile environment (Chartered Surveyors, High-Mountain Guides, Geologists, Teria/Topcon Representatives).

membre: Théo ROCHAIS (Internship supervisor, head of surveying department)
description_mission: Completion of a four-month long-term professionalizing mission (September - December 2024) at GRAPHEAU, an engineering firm, under the supervision of Mr. Théo ROCHAIS (head of surveying department), located in St Pierre de Vassols.
The main objective of the mission was to optimize data acquisition and processing steps, focusing on the stormwater networks of the city of Orange.
Implementation and execution of combined survey campaigns: NRTK GNSS (Leica GS07, Land2Map, Teria) and photogrammetric (GoPro Hero 8 on a pole) for network mapping.
Complete processing of data acquired in the field (Land2Map, Geosnap online service, AutoCAD).
Integration of processed data into a municipal GIS using QGIS.
materiels: Vivax transmitter, rod, and detector pack

description_mission: Participation in two topographic survey missions for the Junior-Enterprise SR Topo (January and October 2023) in Cesseville and Ecquetot.
Conduction of a topographic survey of cemeteries to produce a comprehensive existing-conditions plan and a future development plan for the town halls.
Exhaustive collection of census data (name, dates of birth/death) and photographs of each grave for integration into the database.
Data processing, CAD operations, and construction of the Geographic Information System (GIS) using QGIS software.
Collaborative work within a Junior-Enterprise and **skill development** thanks to assistance from senior students.

images_data.image_caption: Emilien Crevel, Manuel CASTET (from left to right)

membre: Emilien CREVEL, Mathieu MARTINEZ, Manuel CASTET (students)
description_mission: Participation in two topographic survey missions for the Junior-Enterprise SR Topo (January and October 2023) in Cesseville and Ecquetot.
Conduction of a topographic survey of cemeteries to produce a comprehensive existing-conditions plan and a future development plan for the town halls.

titre: Archaeological excavations at Castella de Labarre
lieu: Castella de Labarre, Foix, Ariège (09), FRANCE
membres: Mr. Laurent CLAEYS (Excavation Director, Archaeologist); Mr. Philippe SABLAYROLLES (Pedag. coord. BTS MGTMN); Mr. Philippe BOSCARIOL (Chartered Surveyor), Ms. Aurore BRILLAC, Ms. Mathilde SERRES, Mr. Hugo FAVRAIS and Manuel CASTET (students)
description_mission: Defining needs in accordance with the archaeologist's (Mr. Laurent CLAEYS) study objectives.
Carrying out topographic surveys of the site and the ditches bordering the fortification to update the plans (Leica TS07 total station).
Photogrammetric modeling (acquisition, georeferencing) to model archaeological elements (ruined wall, test pits).
Collaboration within a team of surveyors (BTS MGTMN and Chartered Surveyor) and active participation in the excavations alongside the archaeologist interns.

images_data.image_caption: Excavators under the eye of L.CLAEYS.

images_data.image_source: Source: Photograph by Philippe Sablayrolles https://urlr.me/HsbF6T

competences: Ability to integrate quickly and benefit from the feedback of the Engineer managers
description_mission: Acquisition of professional experience as a surveyor's assistant for two months (July-August 2021) at the G.O METRES Firm.
Application and consolidation of knowledge and techniques learned during the 1st year of the BTS MGTMN and internship.
Execution of several land-related missions: boundary surveys and parcel divisions for various types of clients (individuals, developers, local authorities).
Reinforcement of the use of data acquisition tools: total stations and GNSS receivers.
Participation in Project Management affairs and management of document archiving and file referencing on Géofoncier.
Completion of a first-year internship (May-June 2021) at Acti-Géo Firm, directed by Mr. Laurent TASSEL, focused on new technologies.
Professional application of methods and tools acquired during training (BTS MGTMN).
Topographic surveys using a total station (Trimble S7) and a GNSS receiver (Trimble R8).
Data processing (Covadis, AutoCAD).

Participation in innovative missions involving the use of drones: bathymetric surveys of quarry lakes with the aqua-drone (WaterRobotics), georeferencing, and real-time trajectory tracking (RTK, Septentrio NR3, Qinsy).
Interior and facade surveys with a 3D scanner (Zoller+Fröhlich 5016) and data processing (Trimble Realworks, CloudCompare).
Photogrammetric survey with a DJI Mavic Pro drone and data processing (Agisoft Metashape) for the creation of orthoimages.
Acquisition of the principles of mission organization, from client request to deliverable submission.
Handling of data related to land operations and contribution to the establishment of land deeds (SPF, Géofoncier, Word).

images_data.image_caption: Aquadrone WaterRobotics, equipped with a Septentrio Altus NR3 GNSS receiver and a GoPro

description_mission: Introduction to the professional practices of a Chartered Surveyor following two discovery days (March 2020) at Mr. Franck GILG's firm.
Familiarization with the installation and handling of survey tools: total station and GNSS receiver.
Acquisition of the basics of the land domain and understanding of the mediation role inherent in the profession of Chartered Surveyor.
Processing and exploitation of acquired field data using the specialized software Covadis.
Introduction to drafting various plans in a Computer-Aided Design (CAD) environment on AutoCAD and to geodatabase processing (Covadis).
